result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamont Laverne Keith Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 monthly, commencing 07/11/15, and the 11th of each moth thereafter, until paid in full or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamont Laverne Keith Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Per Order signed on 6/22/2015: credit correct to show four (4) days.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: CORRECTION to 6-11-2015 Plea/Sentencing entry:   Defendant ordered to serve 12 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 4 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Lamont Laverne Keith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Defendant ordered to serve 12 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 8 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work and school.
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 monthly, commencing 07-11-2015, and the 11th of each month thereafter, until paid in full or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Sentencing Referral Form
Attorney Williams in court to schedule a plea/sentencing date.  Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing on 6-11-2015 at 8:30 am.  ADA Longo notified.

Defendant Lamont Laverne Keith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 46.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamont Laverne Keith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Lamont Laverne Keith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
